SEARCH
Package it.polimi.GC13.view.TUI

Class TUI

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.GC13.view.TUI.TUI
All Implemented Interfaces:
View
public class TUI extends Object implements View
The TUI class implements View. Initializes a new TUI instance, setting up player data, utility objects, and starting the input reader thread.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

    Description
    TUI()
    Initializes a new TUI instance, setting up player data, utility objects, and starting the input reader thread.

    • drawCard

      public void drawCard()
      Manages the action of drawing a card. Displays the available cards in the gold and resource decks. Allows the player to choose a card to draw if it is their turn, and they have exactly two cards in hand. Sends a message to the virtual server to draw the chosen card. Increments the turn count after successfully drawing a card. Prints an error message and returns if input validation fails or if the action cannot be performed.
      Specified by:
      drawCard in interface View

    • exceptionHandler

      public void exceptionHandler(String playerNickname, OnInputExceptionMessage onInputExceptionMessage)

      Specified by:

      Parameters:
      playerNickname - the nickname of the player
      onInputExceptionMessage - the exception message

    • placeCard

      public void placeCard()
      Manages the action of placing a card on the board: - Displays the player's board and collected resources. - Shows the player's hand of cards. - Allows the player to enter the serial number, X and Y coordinates, and card orientation (front or back). - Sends a message to the server to place the card based on player input. - Prints error messages and returns if input validation fails or if the action cannot be performed. - Displays appropriate messages if it's not the player's turn or if the player has already placed a card.
      Specified by:
      placeCard in interface View

    • showHomeMenu

      public void showHomeMenu()
      Displays the home menu options to the player and handles their selection. Allows the player to choose an action by entering a corresponding number. Executes the chosen action through the `menuChoice` method. Prints error messages and returns if input validation fails or if the action cannot be performed.
      Specified by:
      showHomeMenu in interface View
